alert.note: Alert for Chaves County Plains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 03 at 1:06PM MST until March 04 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM CST /9 AM MST/ TO 9 PM CST /8 PM MST/ FRIDAY FOR RELATIVE HUMIDITY OF 15% OR LESS, 20 FT WINDS OF 20 MPH OR MORE, AND HIGH TO EXTREME FIRE DANGER FOR THE SACRAMENTO FOOTHILLS, GUADALUPE AND DELAWARE MOUNTAINS, SOUTHEAST NEW MEXICO PLAINS, VAN HORN AND THE HIGHWAY 54 CORRIDOR, AND EASTERN CULBERSON COUNTY... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM TO 8 PM MST FRIDAY FOR RELATIVE HUMIDITY OF 15% OR LESS, 20 FT WINDS OF 20 MPH OR MORE, AND HIGH TO EXTREME FIRE DANGER... * AFFECTED AREA...Chaves Plains. * TIMING...From 9 AM to 8 PM MST Friday. * WINDS...South 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 10 percent. * RFTI...4 or near critical.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity and warm temperatures will increase potential for fire growth.
